Paper.Title: Sydney, July 2006. c(c)2006 Association for Computational Linguistics An Improved Redundancy Elimination Algorithm for Underspecified Representations

Section.Paragraph: We present an efficient algorithm for the redundancy elimination problem: Given an underspecified semantic representation (USR) of a scope ambiguity, compute an USR with fewer mutually equivalent readings. Thealgorithm operateson underspecified chart representations which are derived from dominance graphs; it can be applied to the USRs computed by large-scale grammars. We evaluate the algorithm on a corpus, and show that it reduces the degree of ambiguity significantly while taking negligible runtime.
